name: AMBRISENTAN
cautions:
Cautions not to be initiated in significant anaemia; monitor haemoglobin concentration or haematocrit after
1 month and 3 months of starting treatment, and periodically thereafter (reduce dose or discontinue treatment if significant
decrease in haemoglobin concentration or haematocrit observed); monitor liver function before treatment, and monthly
thereafter—discontinue if liver enzymes raised significantly
or if symptoms of liver impairment develop
side-effects:
Side-effects abdominal pain, constipation; palpitation, flushing,
peripheral oedema; upper respiratory-tract disorders; headache; anaemia; less commonly hypersensitivity reactions (including angioedema
and rash)
doses:
adult over 18 years, 5 mg
once daily, increased if necessary to 10 mg once daily
